text:

/opt/hpws/apache/logs/httpd.pid (pid=29823)
[Fri Oct 26 17:56:25 2007] [notice] caught SIGTERM, shutting down
[Fri Oct 26 17:57:27 2007] [info] Init: Initializing OpenSSL library

In short, server becomes unreachable from 14:30. It is restarted manually at 17:56.

Here is our configuration regarding to clients management:
<IfModule worker.c>
StartServers         2
MaxClients         150
MinSpareThreads     25
MaxSpareThreads     75 
ThreadsPerChild     25
MaxRequestsPerChild  4
</IfModule>

Note: It will be difficult to upgrade the server. A solution with modifications
in httpd.conf only would be great.

Thanks for any help
creator: antonio.da-silva@cegelec.com
nick@webthing.com
text:
1.  This kind of thing usually comes from an application.  The instances of
".php" in your access log give us a strong suspect.
2.  You appear to be using PHP with Worker MPM.  Didn't you read the warnings?
3.  The first fix to "bug in an old version" is always to upgrade.  Even if 2.2
is not an option, there are more recent 2.0 versions offering bugfixes.
